subject: Re: [junit] boilerplate for testEquals, testCompareTo, testHashCode wanted
msgSnippet: ... Try GSBase on SourceForge. I know it has a class called EqualsTester that takes either three or four instances of a class and tests for equals() and
messageBody:
> Hi,
>
> Does anyone have any empirical boilerplate junit test methods that
> exercise the following commonly implemented/overridden methods of an
> arbitrary class?:
> equals method
> compareTo method (if class implements Comparable)
> hashCode method

Try GSBase on SourceForge. I know it has a class called "EqualsTester" that
takes either three or four instances of a class and tests for equals() and
hashCode(). It has some additional restrictions, though, which you may not
agree with. At the very least, you might really like his approach and do
something similar yourself -- then publish it. :)

--
J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
